Posts.Content: Well it’s day 13 post first EC and my hair is falling out in droves as of this morning. My hair is currently shoulder length and quite thick, I’m not sure whether to have it cut in to a short style or just buzz cut it so I don’t notice it coming out as much. My head feels very odd, like my hair follicles are super sensitised as if I’ve had a tight pony tail in for too long, very weird. Next EC 12/12, all going well...
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks AnnJac and TheScriptFan. I feel a buzz cut coming on
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thank you birdsofafeather that’s really helpful. I love the fatty meal idea. Sausages beans and chips! Yum! I don’t think I had enough in my stomach when I had my first treatment which made the nausea and vomiting much worse so I’m going to line my stomach pre treatment. I went for a shower last night to ease my aching head and lost LOADS of hair but I still don’t see any gaps but it’s floating about everywhere I’ve ordered a couple of hats as the ones the chemo unit gave me we’re not pretty hope everyone else is doing ok. Thinking of all the lovely folks having treatments etc
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks Shiny. It really is quite uncomfortable isn’t it? A very bizarre feeling. Here’s to quick showers, thankfully I’ve just bought some sink and drain unblocker
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I have had hiccups this time too devondumpling it's giving the children much amusement.  No vomiting requiring a stay at hotel nhs this time, the Emend seems to working well.  I was still very very nauseous on the first night but so much better now.  My new symptom is a red face which I am presuming is the steroids? good luck to those having sessions today
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I'm in for my first radiotherapy this morning.  Can't say I'm looking forward to it but hey ho needs must I suppose .  Im just hoping I can hold my breath well enough as I have a cold and cough just now.  I also have an appointment at the breast clinic tomorrow after my second rads which is adding to my anxiety I think.    I can feel a wee lumpy bit on my affected breast which I am so hopeful is just left over scar tissue from the therapeutic mammoplasty to remove the tumour back in October and nothing sinister.  I just want this all done with now so I can have my life back to some sense of normality.
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Radiotherapy Chat***

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies, it went fine.  I was quite nervous before it whixh I wasnt expecting as I'm usually quite a stoic sort but it was over so quickly without a fuss. I developed a hot, slightly swollen boob last night which I was slightly surprised happened so soon.  I thought it would take time to build up (guess who did no real rads research before starting lol) Apprehensive about breast clinic this afternoon but relieved to have got an appointment so soon after mentioning the lump to the BCN. Good luck to.everyobe else having rads xxx
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Radiotherapy Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi all! This sounds good!  I’m just north of Stirling so Glasgow, Edinburgh or even Dundee would work for me
Posts.Title: 2019 Meet up in Scotland ? Anyone ?

Posts.Content: Yes I went to see Bohemian Rhapsody last night with the hubby and felt a bit like oh sod off, I don't need this when the advert came on.  It's got quite a negative vibe i feel and when you are currently on the journey of treatment and uncertainty it's not really what you want to see/hear.
Posts.Title: MacMillan adverts in cinema

Posts.Content: Yeah I'm on the same regime and my hair started falling out on day 15 of my first cycle.  I kept going with it coming out in huge clumps for a about a week then got fed up as my hair was everywhere and getting on my nerves.  I got hubby to shave it all off to a number 2 one night and got the kids involved too which actually made it a hilarious, lovely family moment, we are a bit nuts in our house lol.  Hubby and I did need a stiff drink afterwards though but it's all come away now.  I have a proper shiny head. I'm just day 1 of cycle 2 and my lashes and eyebrows are certainly getting thin.  Like a lot of people above I too am finding this more upsetting than my hair as I can just bury my head under a woolly hat but I'm worried about it being really visible on my face.
Posts.Title: Hair loss.

Posts.Content: Hope it’s ok to join you all on your walks. Had a lovely yomp across the fields with the big dope that is Murphy dog. I am nearly 5 weeks post bilateral therapeutic mammoplasty and am dearly hoping I can keep walking once my chemo starts next week to keep me both active and sane.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lovely walk with the dog today.whilst I'm feeling energetic between chemo cycles.  Wee bit of snow visible on BenLedi too.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi seaspirit44 Ben Ledi is in Callander north West of Stirling x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: I was in a similar boat, I was told I was borderline for needing chemo. It’s an awful feeling when they tell you it’s up to you isn’t it?  I’m not surprised your head is spinning. I was offered the oncotype DX test but in the end after talking to my hubby, friends and BCN I decided to forego oncotype and take the chemo as my 10 year benefit from the Predict score of having chemo was nearly 9%. I’m waiting to see the oncologist on Friday to find out when my chemo will start. It is a very difficult decision but I felt so much calmer and less all over the place once I’d finally made it, I hope the same for you but it would be so much better if they would guide us more. Can you speak to your breast nurse to try and help you decide?
Posts.Title: What to do for the best

Posts.Content: Warm welcome Kelly38 I am half way through my chemo journey.  I have a soon to be 7 year old boy and a 9 year old girl.  I was honest with them about losing my hair and in fact when it started coming out in clumps I got my hubby to shave it off and we involved the kids in the shaving.  Both kids took it in their stride and made it this really lovely family moment.  Both kids kept some of my hair as a memento but have been absolutely grand with me having no hair and seeing me wandering around the house without a hat or scarf on.  Kids are remarkably resilient and matter of fact about these things.  Much hugs x
Posts.Title: Got Treatment Plan

Posts.Content: So last chemo was 6th March.   I had my planning CT scan for radiotherapy last Thursday and the plan was for 3 weeks of whole breast radio followed by 4 boost doses to the tumour bed which is marked with internal clips after my therapeutic mammoplasty in October.   The oncologist phoned me this morning to say that the tumour bed area ion the CT is too large in relation to the breast tissue left post op and they can no longer do the boost sessions as the side eects would be too great.  Has anyone else had radio but no boost?  I'm just worried as I feel that I was throwing everything at this horrible disease and now part of it has been taken away leaving me at higher risk of local recurrence.  I'm going to try and formulate some questions for the breast nurse but I feel a bit down that I am missing an important part of the treatment if that makes sense.  Probably being stupid
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy...no boost doses
